attributes.title: Paramahamsa Nithyananda's 2009 Gurupoornima Message
attributes.description:
The auspicious occasion of Guru Poornima was celebrated with great devotion and enthusiasm at Nithyananda Dhyanapeetam, Bidadi on July 7, 2009.

Guru Poornima is a beautiful day of great reverence reminding one of the deepest of relationships  guru-disciple relationship. This is the only day when the guru takes bhiksha (offering) from his devotees while the devotees have the gift of the opportunity to offload their karmas and ego at the feet of the guru. 

In his address to the tens of thousands who had gathered on Guru Poornima, Paramahamsa Nithyananda spoke on vitarka  the right reasoning that helps overcome all suffering in life and which enables us to live life in an auspicious manner. Instead of living in vitarka we live spend our life in kutarka, which is the logic of cunning behavior. Such cunning logic may in the short run seem to bring us material benefits but it always results in suffering.

Vitarka or right reasoning results in is-ness, just being. Is-ness in turn results in ease-ness, which is happiness and bliss. Following the Masters words and his body language helps develop vitarka. 

Discourses on wide variety of topics on sacred scriptures and life solutions delivered by Paramahamsa Nithyananda may be ordered online at www.lifeblissgalleria.com
